data.enText: type
a type or variety of sth

data.chText: 运输种类；政体类型；能源种类
data.enText: forms of transport/government/energy
one of the most common forms of cancer

data.chText: 当今地球上所有的几百万生命种类
data.enText: all the millions of different life forms on the planet today
way sth is/looks
the particular way sth is, seems, looks or is presented

data.chText: 这种疾病可能有几种不同的形式。
data.enText: The disease can take several different forms.

data.chText: 以钱的形式资助将十分受欢迎。
data.enText: Help in the form of money will be very welcome.
Help arrived in the form of two police officers.

data.chText: 培训课程采取一系列研讨会的形式。
data.enText: The training programme takes the form of a series of workshops.

data.chText: 多数政治问题牵涉到这样或那样的道义性。
data.enText: Most political questions involve morality in some form or other .

data.chText: 我们需要达成某种形式的协议。
data.enText: We need to come to some form of agreement.

data.chText: 我反对任何形式的审查。
data.enText: I'm opposed to censorship in any shape or form .

data.chText: 这部词典也有电子版本的。
data.enText: This dictionary is also available in electronic form.
document
an official document containing questions and spaces for answers

data.chText: 申请 / 报名表；订货单
data.enText: an application/entry/order form
to fill in a form
to fill out a form

data.chText: 我在他们的网站上填了一张表。
data.enText: I filled in/out a form on their website.
to complete a form
a booking form
a reservation form
shape
the shape of sb/sth; a person or thing of which only the shape can be seen
her slender form

data.chText: 3万多年以来，人的体形没有多大变化。
data.enText: The human form has changed little over the last 30 000 years.

data.chText: 他们隐约认出了前面的模糊人影。
data.enText: They made out a shadowy form in front of them.
arrangement of parts

data.chText: （尤指艺术作品或文章的）结构，形式
data.enText: the arrangement of parts in a whole, especially in a work of art or piece of writing

data.chText: 小说的形式和内容同样重要。
data.enText: In a novel form and content are equally important.
being fit/healthy
how fit and healthy sb is; the state of being fit and healthy

data.chText: 经过半年的训练，全队状态极佳。
data.enText: After six months' training the whole team is in superb form.
I really need to get back in form .
The horse was clearly out of form .
performance
how well sb/sth is performing; the fact that sb/sth is performing well

data.chText: 中场队员埃利奥特近来表现令人失望。
data.enText: Midfielder Elliott has shown disappointing form recently.

data.chText: 就该党目前情况来看，下届选举又会胜利。
data.enText: On current/present form the party is heading for another election victory.

data.chText: 她令人信服的胜利显示她已恢复状态。
data.enText: She signalled her return to form with a convincing victory.

data.chText: 他在最近的一部电影中扮演疯狂的理科教师，表现出色。
data.enText: He's right on form (= performing well) as a crazy science teacher in his latest movie.

data.chText: 全队表现良好，获胜是理所当然的。
data.enText: The whole team was on good form and deserved the win.
She was in great form (= happy and cheerful and full of energy) at the wedding party.
way of doing things
the usual way of doing sth

data.chText: 申请科研补助金按常规应该怎么办？
data.enText: What's the form when you apply for a research grant?
conventional social forms

data.chText: 他和往常一样迟到了一小时。
data.enText: True to form (= as he usually does) he arrived an hour late.

data.chText: 按惯例，雇员的配偶受到了邀请。
data.enText: Partners of employees are invited as a matter of form .
the way of doing things that is socially acceptable/not socially acceptable
of word
a way of writing or saying a word that shows, for example, if it is plural or in a particular tense
the infinitive form of the verb
in school
a class in a school
Who's your form teacher?
a student in the form mentioned at school
a third-former
take form
to gradually form into a particular shape; to gradually develop

data.chText: 一个新的生命在她的体内逐渐形成。
data.enText: In her body a new life was taking form.
in any (way,) shape or form
of any type

data.chText: 我不赞成任何形式的暴力行为。
data.enText: I don't approve of violence in any shape or form.
start to exist
to begin to exist and gradually develop into a particular shape; to make sth begin to exist in a particular shape
Flowers appeared, but fruits failed to form.
Storm clouds are forming on the horizon.

data.chText: 这些山丘是冰川作用形成的。
data.enText: These hills were formed by glaciation.
to start to exist and develop; to make sth start to exist and develop

data.chText: 一个计划在我的头脑中形成。
data.enText: A plan formed in my head.

data.chText: 我大学时结交了许多密友。
data.enText: I formed many close friendships at college.

data.chText: 我对这部戏剧了解得不够，说不出什么意见。
data.enText: I didn't see enough of the play to form an opinion about it.
make shape/form
to produce sth in a particular way or make it have a particular shape

data.chText: 用手把生面团揉成一些球团。
data.enText: Form the dough into balls with your hands.
Bend the wire so that it forms a ‘V’.

data.chText: 重新排列字母，组成另一单词。
data.enText: Rearrange the letters to form a new word.

data.chText: 游戏可以帮助儿童学会组合字母。
data.enText: Games can help children learn to form letters.

data.chText: 你知道怎样构成过去时吗？
data.enText: Do you know how to form the past tense?
The chain is formed from 136 links.
to move or arrange objects or people so that they are in a group with a particular shape; to become arranged in a group like this

data.chText: 排成一行 / 长列 / 圈
data.enText: to form a line/queue/circle

data.chText: 首先让学生分成四人一组。
data.enText: First get students to form groups of four.
Queues were already forming outside the theatre.
The teams formed up into lines.
have function/role
to have a particular function or pattern

data.chText: 树木起天然的保护作用，遮挡了阳光的照射。
data.enText: The trees form a natural protection from the sun's rays.
to be sth

data.chText: 这座城堡是城市的中心。
data.enText: The castle forms the focal point of the city.

data.chText: 这个调查是研究计划的一部分。
data.enText: The survey formed part of a larger programme of research.

data.chText: 这些画作将成为展览的基本部分。
data.enText: These drawings will form the basis of the exhibition.
organization
to start a group of people, such as an organization, a committee, etc.; to come together in a group of this kind
They hope to form the new government.

data.chText: 他和来自学校的一些朋友组成一支乐队。
data.enText: He formed a band with some friends from school.
a newly-formed political party
The band formed in 2003.
have influence on
to have an influence on the way that sth develops

data.chText: 正反两方面的经历都影响儿童性格的形成。
data.enText: Positive and negative experiences form a child's character.

data.text: make ♦ create ♦ develop ♦ produce ♦ generate ♦ form

data.chText: 以上各词均含制造、使产生之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to make sth from parts or materials, or to cause sth to exist or happen.
make
to create or prepare sth by combining materials or putting parts together; to cause sth to exist or happen
She makes her own clothes.

data.chText: 她给主持面试者留下了很好的印象。
data.enText: She made a good impression on the interviewer.
create
to make sth exist or happen, especially sth new that did not exist before

data.chText: 科学家对宇宙是怎样形成的有分歧。
data.enText: Scientists disagree about how the universe was created.

data.chText: make较通用，较常用以指物质的东西，如制造桌子、做衣服、做蛋糕通常用make，但创造就业机会/财富用create。要强调某物品或实体事物是原创的或不同寻常，也可用create：
data.enText: Make is a more general word and is more often used for physical things: you would usually make a table/dress/cake but create jobs/wealth . You can use create for sth physical in order to emphasize how original or unusual the object is.

data.chText: 品尝一下这道新菜吧，是我们厨师长首创的。
data.enText: Try this new dish, created by our head chef.
make or create?
develop

data.chText: （尤用于商务语境）开发，研制（产品）：
data.enText: (used especially in business contexts) to think of and produce a new product
to develop new software
produce

data.chText: 指生产、制造（商品）；（运用技巧）制作、造出：
data.enText: to make things to be sold; to create sth using skill
a factory that produces microchips
generate

data.chText: 指创造、产生（电、财富或主意）：
data.enText: to produce or create sth, especially power, money or ideas
to generate electricity

data.chText: 集思广益是出主意的好办法。
data.enText: Brainstorming is a good way of generating ideas.
form
[often passive] to make sth from sth else; to make sth into sth else

data.chText: 重新排列字母，组成另一单词。
data.enText: Rearrange the letters to form a new word.

data.chText: 这根链条由136个链节组成。
data.enText: The chain is formed from 136 links.
to make/create/develop/produce/generate/form sth from/out of sth
to make/form sth into sth
to make/produce wine
to create/develop a new product
to create/produce/generate income/profits/wealth
to produce/generate electricity/heat/power

ex.enText: My room is in the shape of a square.
Dough can be kneaded into any shape.

ex.chText: 我在黑暗中隐约看出两个模糊的影子。
ex.enText: I made out two dim shapes in the dark.

synonyms.bx: 指物体的外形，侧重于外观上的几何形状，也可指人或物模糊而蒙眬的影子。

ex.chText: 那个姑娘体形很美，但长相一般。
ex.enText: The girl has a good figure but a plain face.
He's doing exercises to improve his figure.

ex.chText: 这条连衣裙衬托出她优美的身段。
ex.enText: The dress showed off her lovely figure.

synonyms.bx: 指人体外部线条构成的轮廓，尤指女性的柔美身段。

ex.enText: Churches are often built in the form/shape of a cross.

ex.chText: 一个身材苗条的女人出现在楼梯顶上。
ex.enText: A slender form of a woman appeared at the top of the stairs.

ex.chText: 他隐约认出了前面的模糊人影。
ex.enText: He made out a shadowy form in front of him.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指物体的外形时常可与 shape 换用，也可指人的体形或隐约可见的影子。

data.enText: take form
to gradually form into a particular shape; to gradually develop

data.chText: 一个新的生命在她的体内逐渐形成。
data.enText: In her body a new life was taking form.
in any (way,) shape or form
of any type

data.chText: 我不赞成任何形式的暴力行为。
data.enText: I don't approve of violence in any shape or form.

tr: the spatial arrangement of something as distinct from its substance
example: geometry is the mathematical science of shape

tr: a mold for setting concrete
example: they built elaborate forms for pouring the foundation

tr: a life-size dummy used to display clothes
the visual appearance of something or someone
example: the delicate cast of his features

tr: a particular mode in which something is manifested
example: his resentment took the form of extreme hostility

tr: any spatial attributes (especially as defined by outline)
example: he could barely make out their shapes

tr: an ability to perform well
example: he was at the top of his form
the team was off form last night

tr: alternative names for the body of a human being
example: Leonardo studied the human body
he has a strong physique
the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak

tr: a category of things distinguished by some common characteristic or quality
example: sculpture is a form of art
what kinds of desserts are there?

tr: a perceptual structure
example: the composition presents problems for students of musical form
a visual pattern must include not only objects but the spaces between them

tr: the phonological or orthographic sound or appearance of a word that can be used to describe or identify something
example: the inflected forms of a word can be represented by a stem and a list of inflections to be attached

tr: a printed document with spaces in which to write
example: he filled out his tax form

tr: an arrangement of the elements in a composition or discourse
example: the essay was in the form of a dialogue
he first sketches the plot in outline form

tr: (biology) a group of organisms within a species that differ in trivial ways from similar groups
example: a new strain of microorganisms

tr: a body of students who are taught together
example: early morning classes are always sleepy

tr: (physical chemistry) a distinct state of matter in a system
matter that is identical in chemical composition and physical state and separated from other material by the phase boundary
example: the reaction occurs in the liquid phase of the system

tr: give shape or form to
example: shape the dough
form the young child's character

tr: assume a form or shape
example: the water formed little beads

tr: make something, usually for a specific function
example: She molded the rice balls carefully
Form cylinders from the dough
shape a figure
Work the metal into a sword

tr: establish or impress firmly in the mind
example: We imprint our ideas onto our children

tr: create (as an entity)
example: social groups form everywhere
They formed a company

tr: to compose or represent:"This wall forms the background of the stage setting"
example: The branches made a roof
This makes a fine introduction

tr: develop into a distinctive entity
example: our plans began to take shape

value.def: A form of something is a type or kind of it.

example.ex: He contracted a rare form of cancer...
example.tran: 他得了一种罕见的癌症。

example.ex: Doctors are willing to take some form of industrial action...
example.tran: 医生们愿意采取某种形式的劳工行动。

example.ex: I am against hunting in any form.
example.tran: 我反对任何形式的狩猎。

value.def: When something can exist or happen in several possible ways, you can use form to refer to one particular way in which it exists or happens.

example.ex: Valleys often take the form of deep canyons...
example.tran: 山谷经常以深峡谷的形态存在。

example.ex: They received a benefit in the form of a tax reduction...
example.tran: 他们获得了减税优惠。

example.ex: In its present form, the law could lead to new injustices.
example.tran: 以其目前的形式而言，这项法规可能会带来新的不公。

value.def: When a particular shape forms or is formed, people or things move or are arranged so that this shape is made.

example.ex: A queue forms outside Peter's study...
example.tran: 彼得书房外面排起了队。

example.ex: They formed a circle and sang 'Auld Lang Syne'...
example.tran: 他们围成一个圆圈，唱起了《友谊地久天长》。

example.ex: The General gave orders for the cadets to form into lines.
example.tran: 将军命令军校学员们站成几排。

value.tran: 形成;(使)排列成;组成…形状

value.def: The form of something is its shape.

example.ex: ...the form of the body.
example.tran: 体形

value.def: You can refer to something that you can see as a form if you cannot see it clearly, or if its outline is the clearest or most striking aspect of it.

example.ex: She thought she'd never been so glad to see his bulky form.
example.tran: 她想她从来没有因看到他那肥胖的身躯而如此高兴。

value.def: If something is arranged or changed so that it becomes similar to a thing with a particular structure or function, you can say that it forms that thing.

example.ex: These panels folded up to form a screen some five feet tall...
example.tran: 这些嵌板折起来组成了一个约 5 英尺高的屏风。

example.ex: All the buildings have names and form a half circle.
example.tran: 所有的建筑都有名称，连在一起构成了一个半圆。

value.def: If something consists of particular things, people, or features, you can say that they form that thing.

example.ex: ...the articles that formed the basis of Randolph's book...
example.tran: 构成伦道夫此书的基础的那些文章

example.ex: Cereals form the staple diet of an enormous number of people around the world.
example.tran: 谷类是世界范围内很大一部分人的主要食物。

value.def: If you form an organization, group, or company, you start it.

example.ex: They tried to form a study group on human rights...
example.tran: 他们试图组建一个人权问题研究小组。

example.ex: They formed themselves into teams.
example.tran: 他们组成了几个队。

value.def: When something natural forms or is formed, it begins to exist and develop.

example.ex: The stars must have formed 10 to 15 billion years ago...
example.tran: 这些恒星一定是形成于 100 到 150 亿年前。

example.ex: Huge ice sheets were formed.
example.tran: 巨大的冰层形成了。

value.def: If you form a relationship, a habit, or an idea, or if it forms, it begins to exist and develop.

example.ex: This should help him form lasting relationships...
example.tran: 这应该能帮助他建立持久的关系。

example.ex: She had formed the habit of giving herself freely to men...
example.tran: 她已经养成了对男人投怀送抱的习惯。

example.ex: An idea formed in his mind.
example.tran: 他的脑海里有了一个念头。

value.tran: (使)(关系、习惯或想法)形成;(使)产生

value.def: If you say that something forms a person's character or personality, you mean that it has a strong influence on them and causes them to develop in a particular way.

example.ex: Anger at injustice formed his character.
example.tran: 对不公正现象的愤怒塑造了他的性格。

value.def: In sport, form refers to the ability or success of a person or animal over a period of time.

example.ex: His form this season has been brilliant...
example.tran: 他这一赛季状态非常不错。

example.ex: Leconte showed good form.
example.tran: 勒孔特表现出良好的状态。

value.tran: (运动员或参赛动物的)竞技状态,表现状态

value.def: A form is a paper with questions on it and spaces marked where you should write the answers. Forms usually ask you to give details about yourself, for example when you are applying for a job or joining an organization.

example.ex: You will be asked to fill in a form with details of your birth and occupation.
example.tran: 你将需要填写一张有关生日和职业详情的表格。

example.ex: ...application forms.
example.tran: 申请表

value.def: If you say that it is bad form to behave in a particular way, you mean that it is rude and impolite.

example.ex: It was thought bad form to discuss business on social occasions.
example.tran: 在社交场合讨论生意被认为是不礼貌的。

gramarinfo.label: usu PHR after v, v-link PHR

value.tran: 讨厌的行为;不礼貌的行为

value.def: If you say that someone is in good form, you mean that they seem healthy and cheerful.
value.tran: 身体健康;情况良好;心情愉悦

value.def: If you say that someone is off form, you think they are not performing as well as they usually do.
If you say that someone is on form, you think that they are performing their usual activity very well.

example.ex: Robert Redford is back on form in his new movie 'Sneakers'.
example.tran: 罗伯特·雷德福在新片《通天神偷》中恢复了表演水准。

value.tran: 状态良好;表现出色;发挥正常

value.def: When something takes form, it develops or begins to be visible.

example.ex: As plans took form in her mind, she realized the need for an accomplice...
example.tran: 随着计划在脑海里逐渐成形，她意识到需要找一个帮手。

example.ex: The face of Mrs Lisbon took form in the dimness.
example.tran: 昏暗中，里斯本夫人的脸慢慢变得清晰起来。

value.def: If someone or something behaves true to form, they do what is expected and is typical of them.

example.ex: Before the train had left the outskirts of London he behaved true to form and began a conversation...
example.tran: 一如往常，列车还没驶出伦敦郊区，他就开始和别人聊起天来。

example.ex: My luck was running true to form...
example.tran: 我的运气和往常一样。

example.ex: True to form, she kept her guests waiting for more than 90 minutes.
example.tran: 和平常一样，她让客人们等了 90 多分钟。

trans: 讨厌的行为;不礼貌的行为
粘附形式，粘附语素(不能单独成词，只作词的构成部分。如slowly中的ly)
(语法结构或表达的)规范形式，最基本形式(如动词的不定式)
构词成分，组合形式(能与另一词或另一构词成分构成新词，如technophobe 一词中的techno-和-phobe )
第六学级(英国中等学校的最高年级，学生年龄在16至18岁之间，准备参加高级证书考试)
